an5.170:1.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
an5.170:1.2: Then Venerable Bhaddaji went up to Venerable Ānanda, and exchanged greetings with him.
an5.170:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and Venerable Ānanda said to him:
an5.170:1.4: “Reverend Bhaddaji, what is the best sight, the best sound, the best happiness, the best perception, and the best state of existence?”
an5.170:2.1: “Reverend, there is this Divinity, the vanquisher, the unvanquished, the universal seer, the wielder of power. When you see the Divinity, that’s the best sight.
an5.170:2.2: There are the gods called ‘of streaming radiance’, who are drenched and steeped in pleasure.
an5.170:2.3: Every so often they feel inspired to exclaim:
an5.170:2.5: When you hear that, it’s the best sound.
an5.170:2.6: There are the gods called ‘of universal beauty’.
an5.170:2.7: Since they’re truly content, they experience pleasure. This is the best happiness.
an5.170:2.8: There are the gods reborn in the dimension of nothingness. This is the best perception.
an5.170:2.9: There are the gods reborn in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the best state of existence.”
an5.170:2.10: “So, Venerable Bhaddaji, do you agree with what most people say about this?”
an5.170:3.2: Why don’t you clarify this yourself?”
an5.170:3.3: “Well then, Reverend Bhaddaji, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
an5.170:4.1: “What you see when the defilements are ended without delay is the best sight.
an5.170:4.2: What you hear when the defilements are ended without delay is the best sound.
an5.170:4.3: The happiness you feel when the defilements are ended without delay is the best happiness.
an5.170:4.4: What you perceive when the defilements are ended without delay is the best perception.
an5.170:4.5: The state of existence in which the defilements are ended without delay is the best state of existence.”
